A story published Saturday said Mitch Daniels would be the odds-on favorite for the GOP nomination in 2012 if pundits, conservative columnists and political thinkers represented the party's base. The diminutive Hoosier has nurtured a profile as a mature politician whose outlook extends beyond the next news cycle and whose demeanor exudes seriousness, the story said. It also noted that the candidate favored by party elites has almost always failed to win the nomination. As for Mike Pence , a story Friday highlighted the effort by a group of conservatives

"The Congress can do better in terms of replacing Barack ObamaCare with commonsense reforms that will bring down the cost of health insurance and expand access for more Americans." And repeal means keeping a promise, he added. "This is what we said we would do. We listened to the people- we made a commitment to them- a pledge to make their priorities our priorities." night that compared the Republicans' tactics to those of the Nazis. "They don't like the truth, so they summarily dismiss it," Steve Cohen , who is Jewish, said of the Republicans. They say it's a government takeover of healthcare. A big lie, just like[ Nazi propaganda minister Joseph] Goebbels. "You say it enough and you repeat the lie, repeat the lie, repeat the lie until eventually people believe it. Like blood libel, that's the same kind of thing, he added. "The Germans said enough about the Jews and people believed it, and you have the Holocaust." The debate took place less than two weeks after an Arizona shooting rampage targeting Mike Pence
